title: LeBron James threw an incredible, no-look pass while falling down
text:
LeBron James threw an amazing, no-look pass over his head to Danny Green while falling down. Green sank the three-pointer.

James finished the game with 11 assists and might have had another on a slick bounce pass to Green, whose shot was blocked.

Watch the two plays below.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

With NBA preseason underway, LeBron James looks to already be in regular-season mode.

On Wednesday, James and the Los Angeles Lakers beat the Golden State Warriors, 126-93, with James tallying 18 points and 11 assists in 25 minutes of play.

James' highlight of the night came in the third quarter, when on a fastbreak, he leapt in the air, spun around, and threw a no-look pass to Danny Green in the corner, all while falling down. The pass somehow made its way to Green, who sank the three, as James got back to his feet.

James also threw a slick bounce pass to Green earlier in the night that would have been his best assist of the game if the shot had not been blocked. Luckily, Anthony Davis was there to clean it up.

The Lakers are 3-2 in preseason. They kick off the regular season against the Los Angeles Clippers on Tuesday, October 22.
description: LeBron James needed only 25 minutes to rack up 11 assists and an impressive highlight against the Warriors in preseason.
